data.question: What are coordination compounds used for in lithium storage?
data.answer: Coordination compounds are used as new materials for lithium storage due to their designable structures, abundant active sites, and facile as well as mild synthetic routes.

data.question: Why is Co-HIPA preferred over other M-HIPAs for anode materials?
data.answer: Co-HIPA is preferred because it showed superior electrolyte stability, reversible capacity, cycle stability, and excellent rate performance compared to other M-HIPAs.

data.question: True or False: Mn-HIPA can be used as an anode material due to its high stability in electrolyte.
What is the theoretical specific capacity of graphite as an anode material?
What method was used to study the lithium storage mechanism of Co-HIPA and Ni-HIPA?
data.answer: A combination of density functional theory (DFT) calculations and experimental results was used.

data.question: True or False: The study found that the lithium-storage mechanism in coordination networks is well understood.
What was the reversible capacity of Co-HIPA at 1000 mA g@1 after 1000 cycles?
How did the electronic structures of the metal centers influence the lithium storage performance?
data.answer: The electronic structures of the metal centers have a significant influence on the lithium storage performance of coordination compounds.

data.question: True or False: Ni-HIPA showed better rate performance than Co-HIPA.
What was the initial Coulombic efficiency (CE) of Co-HIPA?
Why did the initial capacity loss of Co-HIPA and Ni-HIPA occur?
data.answer: The initial capacity loss is mainly due to the formation of solid electrolyte interface (SEI) layers.

data.question: True or False: The PXRD patterns of Co-HIPA and Ni-HIPA changed significantly after being soaked in electrolyte for 10 days.
What was the reversible capacity of Co-HIPA at 5000 mA g@1?
How did the Gibbs free energies (DG) correlate with the electrolyte stability of M-HIPAs?
data.answer: The order of DG values is in accordance with the electrolyte stability test, suggesting a correlation between DG values and electrolyte stability.

data.question: True or False: The CV curves of Co-HIPA and Ni-HIPA became almost overlapping with increasing cycles.
What was the charge capacity of Ni-HIPA at 200 mA g@1 after 200 cycles?
Why did Co-HIPA and Ni-HIPA become fully amorphized after cycles?
data.answer: The initial lithiation-delithiation processes induced an amorphization process losing long-range structural ordering.

data.question: True or False: The lithiation-delithiation processes of Co-HIPA and Ni-HIPA are chemically unstable.
What contributed to the reversible lithium storage performance of Co-HIPA and Ni-HIPA?
data.answer: The redox reactions of metal center and the lithiation-delithiation sites of organic ligands contributed to the reversible lithium storage performance.

data.question: True or False: The study provided a deep understanding of the lithium-ion storage mechanism in coordination compounds.
